basics.name: Zitong (Amelie) Gao

basics.summary: PhD in Molecular Biosciences and Bioengineering, USPTO Registered Patent Agent

Research Experience.name: Bioinformatics Core, John A. Burns School of Medicine, University of Hawaiʻi at Mānoa Cancer Center
Research Experience.summary: Teaching at Palmer Physical Laboratory (now 302 Frist Campus Center). While not a professor at Princeton, I associated with the physics professors and continued to give lectures on campus.
highlights: Enhanced microRNA/piRNA Target Prediction Model Using Transformers and Base-Pairing Patterns(Deep Learning, Sequence Models)
Optimized Random Forest Model combined with Logistic Regression for Non-small cell lung cancer diagnosis using PIWI-interacting RNA (piRNA) (Machine Learning, Binary Classification, Statistics)

Applied ML models to Identify Promising Diagnostic and Prognostic Signatures With Clinical Characteristics from tRNA derived fragments (tRDF) (Machine Learning, Binary Classification, Statistics, Survival Analysis)
